videoSnippet.title: Incredible Upset! 10-year-old (1733) Beats A Grandmaster (2575)
videoSnippet.description:
#agadmator subscribers.videos.agadmator@gmail.com
Send me your photos and videos to this email :)

We all love upsets! That too when a young boy beats a seasoned grandmaster. Souhardo Basak beat GM Adam Tukhaev in the first round of Bhopal International Grandmaster event 2017. Souhardo, a shy 10-year-old from Kolkata rated just 1733 played a fine game to get the better of the Ukrainian GM who has won many big events in the past. Indian chess is blessed that it has four extremely strong tournaments lined up one after the other starting with Bhopal. It's a great exposure for our youngsters. Souhardo proved it in the first round. After beating a 2575 rated GM your confidence is propelled to an altogether different level! 
https://chessbase.in/news/Bhopal_2017_Round_1

Souhardo, Basak 1733 - Tukhaev, Adam 2575
Sicilian Defense: Taimanov Variation (B46)

1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 e6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nc6 5. Nc3 d6 6. Be3 a6 7. Be2 Nf6 8. O-O Be7 9. Nb3 O-O 10. f4 b5 11. a3 Bb7 12. Bf3 Rc8 13. Qe1 Qc7 14. Rd1 Rfe8 15. Qg3 Ba8 16. Qf2 Qb8 17. g4 a5 18. g5 Nd7 19. Bg4 b4 20. axb4 axb4 21. Ne2 Bf8 22. Ng3 g6 23. e5 Nd8 24. exd6 h5 25. Bf3 Bxf3 26. Qxf3 Rxc2 27. Ne4 Nb7 28. Rf2 Rec8 29. Rxc2 Rxc2 30. Nd4 Rc8 31. Qh3 Nd8 32. Nf3 Qa8 33. Ne5 Qxe4 34. Nxd7 Bg7 35. Nf6+ Bxf6 36. gxf6 Rc2 37. d7 Qc6 38. Qg3 Rxb2 39. Bf2 Qc2 40. Rf1 Qf5 41. Bb6 Qxf6
